cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 360 mi SSW of Bermuda (or 785 mi ESE of Cape Fear, NC)
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW–NW across the southwestern Atlantic, slowing and bending toward the North Carolina/South Carolina coast late Thursday-Friday.

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of the NC/VA border to Cape Charles Light, VA and Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River, SC to Duck, NC including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Carolina coastline and much of the Mid-Atlantic seaboard, including Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35-45 mph) possible late Saturday into Sunday as the weakening cyclone tracks inland.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (generally below 3 ft) possible in the upper Chesapeake Bay; greatest surge threats remain south of the bay entrance.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands may deliver 4–8 inches across central Maryland with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Freshwater river flooding and prolonged port-side disruptions from heavy rain and gusty winds.
